snippet.title: COMMENTARY: If millennials leave religion, then what?
snippet.description: As the Pew Research Center recently found, today's young people are "less likely than older generations to be affiliated with any religion." The question is whether this trend is a good thing or a bad thing.

snippet.title: Understanding vertigo, and what to do if you have it
snippet.description: Some high-tech diagnostic tools often lead to a low-tech treatment: a series of careful head repositionings

snippet.title: Why do allergies wax and wane as we age?
snippet.description: Scientists look at clues in the environment, in the role of viruses — and in our minds

snippet.title: The new SAT: Aptitude testing for college admissions falls out of favor
snippet.description: The College Board, once a champion of aptitude testing,now promotes the SAT as an achievement test.

snippet.title: Stowaway teen forces review of airport security
snippet.description: A 15-year-old boy found his way onto an airport's tarmac and climbed into a jetliner's wheel well, then flew for five freezing hours to Hawaii — a misadventure that forced authorities to take a hard look at the security system that protects the nation's airline fleet.

snippet.title: Court to determine what constitutes pomegranate juice
snippet.description: Justices to decide whether a product's label must be based on its dominant contents.

snippet.title: Bulls' Noah the Defensive Player of the Year
snippet.description: There were some emotional moments and some funny stories as Joakim Noah accepted the NBA's Defensive Player of the Year award on Monday, like this one.

snippet.title: Minnesota homeowner's interview played at trial
snippet.description: A Minnesota man on trial for killing two teenagers after they broke into his house had planned the killings, and was lying in wait in his basement with a book, some snacks and two guns, prosecutors said Monday. But a defense attorney countered that his client was terrified after several increasingly violent break-ins and hid after hearing a window break and footsteps upstairs.

snippet.title: Trout, Harper square off in majors for 1st time
snippet.description: Asked what about Bryce Harper impresses him, Mike Trout began with a stock-sounding answer.

snippet.title: Netflix poised to raise prices after strong 1Q
snippet.description: Netflix is preparing a sequel unlikely to be a hit with its subscribers. The Internet video service is about to raise its prices for the first time in three years to help pay for more Internet video programming such as its popular political drama "House of Cards."
